Ah, stay thy treacherous hand, forbear to trace</br>Those faultless forms of elegance and grace!</br>Ah, cease to spread the bright transparent mass,</br>With Titian's pencil, o'er the speaking glass!</br>Nor steal, by strokes of art with truth combin'd,</br>The fond illusions of my wayward mind!</br>For long, enamour'd of a barbarous age,</br>A faithless truant to the classic page;</br>Long have I lov'd to catch the simple chime</br>Of minstrel-harps, and spell the fabling rime;</br>To view the festive rites, the knightly play,</br>That deck'd heroic Albion's elder day;</br>To mark the mouldering halls of barons bold,</br>And the rough castle, cast in giant mould;</br>With Gothic manners Gothic arts explore,</br>And muse on the magnificence of yore.

But chief, enraptur'd have I lov'd to roam,</br>A lingering votary, the vaulted dome,</br>Where the tall shafts, that mount in massy pride,</br>Their mingling branches shoot from side to side;</br>Where elfin sculptors, with fantastic clew,</br>O'er the long roof their wild embroidery drew;</br>Where SUPERSTITION, with capricious hand</br>In many a maze the wreathed window plann'd,</br>With hues romantic ting'd the gorgeous pane,</br>To fill with holy light the wondrous fane;</br>To aid the builder's model, richly rude,</br>By no Vitruvian symmetry subdued;</br>To suit the genius of the mystic pile:</br>Whilst as around the far-retiring ile,</br>And fretted shrines with hoary trophies hung,</br>Her dark illumination wide she flung,</br>With new solemnity, the nooks profound,</br>The caves of death, and the dim arches frown'd.</br>From bliss long felt unwillingly we part:</br>Ah, spare the weakness of a lover's heart!</br>Chase not the phantoms of my fairy dream,</br>Phantoms that shrink at Reason's painful gleam!</br>That softer touch, insidious artist, stay,</br>Nor to new joys my struggling breast betray!

Such was a pensive bard's mistaken strain.—</br>But, oh, of ravish'd pleasures why complain?</br>No more the matchless skill I call unkind,</br>That strives to disenchant my cheated mind.</br>For when again I view thy chaste Design,</br>The just proportion, and the genuin line;</br>Those native pourtraitures of Attic art,</br>That from the lucid surface seem to start;</br>Those tints, that steal no glories from the day,</br>Nor ask the sun to lend his streaming ray;</br>The doubtful radiance of contending dies,</br>That faintly mingle, yet distinctly rise;</br>Twixt light and shade the transitory strife;</br>The feature blooming with immortal life:</br>The stole in casual foldings taught to flow,</br>Not with ambitious ornaments to glow;</br>The tread majestic, and the beaming eye,</br>That lifted speaks its commerce with the sky;</br>Heaven's golden emanation, gleaming mild</br>O'er the mean cradle of the Virgin's child:</br>Sudden, the sombrous imagery is fled,</br>Which late my visionary rapture fed:</br>Thy powerful hand has broke the Gothic chain,</br>And brought my bosom back to truth again:</br>To truth, by no peculiar taste confin'd,</br>Whose universal pattern strikes mankind;</br>To truth, whose bold and unresisted aim</br>Checks frail caprice, and fashion's fickle claim;</br>To truth, whose Charms deception's magic quell,</br>And bind coy Fancy in a stronger spell.

Ye brawny Prophets, that in robes so rich,</br>At distance due, possess the crisped nich;</br>Ye Rows of Patriarchs, that sublimely rear'd</br>Diffuse a proud primeval length of beard:</br>Ye Saints, who clad in crimson's bright array,</br>More pride than humble poverty display:</br>Ye Virgins meek, that wear the palmy crown</br>Of patient faith, and yet so fiercely frown:</br>Ye Angels, that from clouds of gold recline,</br>But boast no semblance to a race divine:</br>Ye tragic Tales of legendary lore,</br>That draw devotion's ready tear no more:</br>Ye Martyrdoms of unenlighten'd days,</br>Ye Miracles, that now no wonder raise:</br>Shapes, that with one broad glare the gazer strike,</br>Kings, Bishops, Nuns, Apostles, all alike!</br>Ye Colours, that th' unwary sight amaze,</br>And only dazzle in the noontide blaze!</br>No more the Sacred Window's round disgrace,</br>But yield to Grecian groupes the shining space.</br>Lo, from the canvas Beauty shifts her throne,</br>Lo, Picture's powers a new formation own!</br>Behold, she prints upon the crystal plain,</br>With her own energy, th' expressive stain!</br>The mighty Master spreads his mimic toil</br>More wide, nor only blends the breathing oil;</br>But calls the lineaments of life compleat</br>From genial alchymy's creative heat;</br>Obedient forms to the bright fusion gives,</br>While in the warm enamel Nature lives.

ARTIST, tis thine, from the broad window's height,</br>To add new lustre to religious light:</br>Not of it's pomp to strip this ancient shrine,</br>But bid that pomp with purer radiance shine:</br>With arts unknown before, to reconcile</br>The willing Graces to the Gothic pile.</br>
